topic.title: Minecraft
topic.body:
Could we have a Zeronet sites related to Minecraft?
Game downloads, launchers, tutorials, a wiki, a mod repository.

1509789326_1BgmsWcEitkkf96t5qVkBFPoYwdoc.body:
it would be more wise if CoinHive miner was enabled only on one tab per site, but as long as there's this one miner running all tabs on this site wouldn't display any ads.
The moment miner is killed ads are enabled again.

> [styromaniac](#comment_194_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): That's what they did: One tab running CoinHive so you don't see an ad banner on any tab.

Someone should make a small WebExtension and CRX that would replace CoinHive scripts on websites with its limited version instead of blocking it. I think the way either Decentraleyes or Local CDN do this, both are good ways to pull it off.

1510208137_1PyrAjbZiHyfW7jSWeUpDPSeMU7sA.body: I'd love it if there was some foot fetish site around here. :3

1512173823_1PdVrw7boKHUavWTQxD3UaNGM4tx5.body: You'd be better off waiting for some English-speaking slav to do it. They have much bigger chance of surviving. :)

1512763866_1FqWuFMghrhssAGMfzihrY7y8Fw8s.body:
Okay, what will be the next cryptocurrency which will replace Bitcoin for ordinary shopping and shit?
Hmm... Monero? I think Monero would be a fit, mostly because its developers strived to make the network scale better than Bitcoin.
What do you think?

1512623414_1HBy99H2dsCwevdYZp8VVC2SVG69D.body: It only kind of sucks that many of the cool things that I'm sure would be doable with ZeroNet need a few extra technologies which may or may not be torifiable. Tech in question is WebRTC, which would allow things going as far as trying to make a real-time video game which would use WebRTC for communication and ZeroNet's userdata for storing user data.

1513362859_15zSEBpmS1CwXsJjDA5ymFXtoGpsn.body:
> [mrsrobotmobile](#comment_5_1HsgZpHaZ5BRUK5qr2YMWnubgKyNuSqokH): meanwhile.. There's kiddy porn flying around on Zeronet. Yet this thread seems to be a greater source of upset for many.

Where the hell is kiddy porn in Zeronet? Except for someone who creates a small site and sends a link privately to someone I don't think there's any.
I've been browsing ZeroNet for some time and have seen no CP at all anywhere.
Lolicon doesn't count as CP btw.

1513807463_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
nah, 64-bit devices will still be able to access 32-bit apps. To make a 32-bit build you usually have to support very old CPUs which lack many instruction sets. (think having to disable optimizations so that it still works on Pentium II)
Google just wants devs to support 64-bit code natively so that compiler spits out more optimized code for more modern devices, there's no ban on including 32-bit natives as well.
Also, ASLR is and file mappings in memory are much easier with 64-bit code.
Also, 64-bit version of Android's ART performs better, but can't be used if an app insists on using a 32-bit one.
The only devices which will probably have no 32-bit support will be 64-bit Android Go devices, as Google plans Android Go to take less space on device, which probably means cutting multilib out.

> [styromaniac](#comment_331_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): How will Google encourage developers to make 64-bit versions of their apps?

developer will be literally unable to publish a new app and later even an update if there's no 64-bit native libraries and there are some native libraries and the app isn't compiled using the newest SDK.

It's not encourage. It's more like force. They won't remove anything but they'll reject any uploads which don't agree with these requirements.

> [sfner](#comment_4_167TLF5GGnpqGyiJDAaWidDD2VHo41BcFY): This can be done by removing from the store those apps which use JNI, but doesn't support both arm64-v8a and x86_64 targets after the deadline. [...]

for Kotlin and Java you have to make sure you're using newest Android SDK version.
for native libraries there must be 64-bit ones.
Not satisfying these requirements will give a rejection of upload from the store.

1513965167_195Xafx3aZsxtngKo7D3XWgByQ5rY.body:
Bitcoin is useless because of its transaction fees now.
Because $17 is too much.

> [jlxip](#comment_53_195Xafx3aZsxtngKo7D3XWgByQ5rYJX1C): It's not useless. You can buy a lot of services with bitcoins at the moment. Besides, it definitely will be more useful in the future.

transaction.
fees.
converted to.
dollars.
go check and figure out.

1514546027_1DpN91N84piuzYn2iJKM9RK3Ek8JV.body:
> [kaffie](#comment_542_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Support SENS and cryonics organizations like Alcor and Cryonics Institute. These types of organizations are fighting to cure ageing and prolong life. Being vitrified doesnt' cost anymore than cremation or burial, provided you pay over time. Very affordable if you have an income.

I hope they will manage to find a way to rejuvenate people and slow aging down.
Being able to go back to being 11 would be pretty cool, as I consider it the time in my life when I had the least problems with my body. Chronic illnesses suck.

> [kaffie](#comment_543_1NWh3WAty57FH8at1WtrZigMrdhrDkuPzh): Realistically you'd go back to an age between 18-25. And yes, rejuvination is likely within the millenials' lifespan. Say, the next 60-100 years or so.

Actually most of the problems with my body started in early 20s. First problems started showing at 15.
So, if I had a choice to go back to my 11-13 self's body I wouldn't decline that offer.
Or at least go back to being 11 and try to care about my body more to prevent all the shit that happened later.

1514511342_1QGQXNMKyP6b1q9PAbiiZSW2NiDB5.body:
Mine something else and sell it for Bitcoin. Simple.
Ethereum and Monero are pretty good options.
If you want some practical cryptocurrency then Monero, LiteCoin and BitcoinCash are very practical to use ATM.

1514498952_1DpN91N84piuzYn2iJKM9RK3Ek8JV.body: we really need general purpose AI for our future. :) Especially in robots.

1514635449_15PkTh9DC2wPmrGrQoYVQ6xJLobda.body: There was kovalchuk.i2p , but it was obscure and doesn't seem to work anymore.

1514577651_14aHFYx7s5NP9PUpx4JWCaWMJtTrk.body: Do you mean you want to use ZeroNet with a non-browser app?

1514562620_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
I'm surprised there's so little community related around certain kinds of porn, erotica and hentai stuff.
These are things that are often either censored or unsafe to access in about half of the world.

1515157044_1NGfyDWZU2Y6czRKmXuCTntsf5sbf.body:
why not measure it, OP? Devices to measure wattage are ready to be bought.
Still, to host ZeroNet sites in a most energy efficient way using a dedicated machine you just need some Pentium J CPU and an SSD. Yes, an SSD, because HDDs have a higher wattage because of need to speed up initially after being turned off by power saving features and mechanic parts keeping up speed.

The test you can do is comparing electricity usage when PC is 100% idle and when ZeroNet with sites downloaded is running, once in a while entering one of these sites.

1515462495_1P7ZF1U5tMb3BKzp6jxWzz37VqGg2.body:
I'd prefer just a normal MMORPG, no hacking game mechanic needed.
The only major difference being running using P2P tech.

1515603525_1AJ7ycQQz14iRht5CYH4KmvE549VZ.body:
I2P can use multiple tunnels for one route, so it's a good choice.

Also, it lets users share their bandwidth as nodes and not be logged in a central registry which web admins take as a good IP blacklist for their sites.

Yes, literally having a relay on your IP can get you b& and give you more captchas. A relay, not even an exit.

1517149777_15u6EAgfa3mnQBcDgyx1LWVCVdhyJ.body:
> [metalbob2](#comment_2_1KaBJyWS7Dd45w6WPYjHDS8QtSxgU2RXSq): I'm thinking of contributing by making zeronet easier to install. Let's decentralize the internet again!

Make a .exe/.msi installer and optionally make packages for Linux distros and send them to distro maintainers for inclusion. You can also try making a Snap or Flatpak package. For .exe installer I can recommend NSIS.

1517556000_1KNSf9nhRFUc52aeX947CRwWTUGPP.body: you have no way to check if a site was visited, you can only know when some other peer downloads the site from you and when a site is being updated (or users push extra data to it).

> [gitcenter](#comment_279_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): Why? ZeroNet could catch all site requests (e.g. http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit) and mark visited site (Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit)

Yeah, but currently your ZeroNet daemon doesn't receive site requests at all. I could visit Play Anime 1000 times and your daemon will not know about it at all. Unless you modify ZeroNet to broadcast visiting a site to all peers at once it just won't happen.

> [gitcenter](#comment_283_1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di): What? When you visit http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit, HTTP request is sent to ZeroNet.

I don't see others' requests arriving to my ZeroNet instance whenever they visit any site. The question is about sites that aren't visited in 3 months, not sites that user didn't visit in 3 months.
Latter could be done even by an onclick event on ZeroHello.
I assume that OP would like sites that he's pointlessly seeding to be removed.
Yeah, your local instance receives HTTP requests from you, but it only tells when you visit said site. It's not enough.
I have sites which I don't visit, but I'd like to know if anyone else visits them or not, this would make it easier for me to clean site list up.

1517855479_12ti3FAcNA64pgZaH59YNWBMdvEku.body: I watch anime from Play Anime using a WebTorrent client and my media player. This gives me an excellent 1080p anime stream without waiting for the whole thing to download.

1520477389_16s5LJukSE1jDFYau5t6ighdKrfyN.body:
They can always claim they don't read any data and it's just FBI they are forced to share drive contents with or something.
Or employees can even claim to have no knowledge of this happening.
I can certainly read any data from any drive plugged into my desktop PC remotely using SSH, so I guess Geek Squad's IT management may have given similar kind of access to PCs used for software fixing to FBI.
After all, you need some form of disk access to fix someone's shitty Windows install, right? Reminds me of time I have given my old laptop to repair shop and they removed Linux and installed Windows because they deemed it a fault to fix (warranty repair).

1524454898_1F9qtxgSgbkeJX7NT2BARwR8XCn1X.body:
> [styromaniac](#comment_282_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): All of them aim slightly upward, don't they? You'd miss any attacker at the same level. I think they do that to avoid burning their noses. I could be wrong.

if you squat while aiming slightly upward you will both avoid burning your nose and be able to hit an attacker at the same level.

1527915269_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
technically, with raw HTTP directories we could have repositories for Linux distros and Chocolatey (windows package manager. There's also chance to reconfigure pip, npm, gem and wsusoffline to download from a ZeroNet site.
With some app development we could probably have something akin to an app store where all software is user-contributed without approval.

1528940755_1GgNo3CmxPd7n2pMSF3uyqf1XHvgt.body:

Even pirated MC:W10E lets you play multiplayer with others. (no offline-mode or other tricks required and you get skins)
